Apr 4, 2020

In this post, we will describe how this conjecture simplifies the main part of the proof of the nilpotence theorem due to Devinatz-Hopkins-Smith. I am currently writing a paper (which is 99% done, I think) about the implications of the centrality conjecture (and applications to the string orientation), and will expand on the stuff in this post in a future paper. The first part (“Step II”) essentially boils down to algebra (or the EHP sequence, depending on how you choose to prove it), and the centrality conjecture has nothing to do with it. The second part (“Step III”), however, is the real meat of the nilpotence theorem, and that’s where centrality comes in.
